page.title: 12The King's Sutton Railway
page.content: The railway is on the outskirts of King's Sutton; it has a small shelter on the platform but no ticket office or cafe. The shelter looks more like a bus stop because it is so small. It is very unusual nowadays to have a station in such a small village. You cannot buy a ticket at the station as there is no-one to buy it from; you pay for the journey on the train. A lot of people in King's Sutton use the train, especially to Banbury, the nearest market town, because it is cheaper and more convenient. They are used to the trains and think they sound friendly.
